titleStmt.title: Daniel L. Baker et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5499

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned Citizens of Webster County Kentucky would respectfully represent to your excelency that J. Calvin Baker of this county was fined twenty five dollars by the Webster Circuit Court at its March term 1864 on a charge of a breach of the Peace that the evidence on the tryal was very slight and only circumstantial and that there were mitigating circumstances which would excuse if not justify said Baker even if guilty and we believe that his is a case in which the exercise of executive clemency would be proper and right
We would threfore must respectfully & earnestly request yoru excelency to remit so much of Said fine as is due the Commonwealth

E Warren
W. S. Baker
C. H. Macelroy
Jacob W Walker
J E Baker
Philip Richards
James P Armstrong
Joseph Dise
Daniel L Baker
Squire Wamac
Geo. P. Casby
C. E. Hutchison
J M Dixon
M C Davis
C. W. Cook
J. F. Jennings
D T Nall
J. K. Thomasson
G C Caines
J. A. Jennings
W. F. Short
John H Bumpass
Wm. C Rayburn
J T Price
J. N. Piland
James M McKinney
Joseph Raybourn
James Daniel
J A Rayburn
Alen Rayburn
Webster Co
J Calvin Baker
$25
~
refused
65

Refused
Richard T. Jacob
Lt. & Act. Gov
